{"step_by_step_thinking": "Calculus is a hard, calcified deposit that forms on the teeth and contributes to their decay. Cementum is a specialized calcified substance covering the root of a tooth. When calculus forms on the tooth, it can cover the cementum. This area is not referred to as a toxic, deposit, or take away zone. However, it can be referred to as an instrumentation zone because it is the area where dental instruments would be used to remove the calculus.", "answer_choice": "C. Instrumentation zone"}
